sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The pleasant historie of the conquest of the VVeast India, now called new Spayne atchieued by the vvorthy prince Hernando Cortes Marques of the valley of Huaxacac, most delectable to reade: translated out of the Spanishe tongue, by T.N. Anno. 1578. Historia general de las Indias. Part 2. English. López de Gómara, Francisco, 1511-1564. Nicholas, Thomas, b. ca. 1532.
[12], 405, [3] p.
By Henry Bynneman, Imprinted at London : [1578]
A translation of part 2 of: Gómara, Franciso López de. Historia general de las Indias. Translator's dedication signed: Thomas Nicholas. Publication date from STC. Running title reads: The conquest of the Weast India. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======
The pleasant historie of the conquest of the VVeast India, now called new Spayne atchieued by the vvorthy prince Hernando Cortes Marques of the valley of Huaxacac, most delectable to reade: translated out of the Spanishe tongue, by T.N. Anno. 1578. Historia general de las Indias. Part 2. English. López de Gómara, Francisco, 1511-1564. Nicholas, Thomas, b. ca. 1532.
[12], 405, [3] p.
By Henry Bynneman, Imprinted at London : [1578]
A translation of part 2 of: Gómara, Franciso López de. Historia general de las Indias. Translator's dedication signed: Thomas Nicholas. Publication date from STC. Running title reads: The conquest of the Weast India. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
Henry Bynneman
